intro: Tithymalus humilis, commonly known as the lesser tithymale, is a small annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and has delicate, branched stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early summer, usually from June to July. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Tithymalus humilis thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
